description.value: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t require air or sleep. In addition, it must consume at least 80 ounces of blood (approximately half the blood in a Medium Humanoid’s body) every 24 hours, or it loses its immunity to exhaustion and risks starvation until it does so. While it has any levels of &Reference[exhaustion]{exhaustion} from starvation, the vampire can’t remove levels of exhaustion until it consumes at least 160 ounces of blood.
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

When it drops to 0 HP outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Mist Form bonus action) instead of falling unconscious, provided it isn’t in sunlight or running water. If it can’t transform, it is destroyed. While it has 0 HP in mist form, it can’t revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 HP. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 HP, it regains 1 HP.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[/healing]] at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP and isn’t in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the vampire’s next turn.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a coffin, grave, sarcophagus, or similar location just large enough for it to lie down designated as its resting place. While in its resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t suffer exhaustion levels from starvation and has keensense out to a range of 120 feet.

JzE8AyylzgWCI8ae.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
JzE8AyylzgWCI8ae.name: Forbiddance

6eC1vSiVDvxMmxNL.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage]] damage if it ends its turn in running water.
6eC1vSiVDvxMmxNL.name: Harmed by Running Water

0XtDu2kazEXaLeSX.description: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s heart while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} in its resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
0XtDu2kazEXaLeSX.name: Stake to the Heart

OEMqQu5lIPfW7tVV.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage]] damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
OEMqQu5lIPfW7tVV.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity

description.value:
The vampire has the following flaws:

  • @Embed[.Activity.JzE8AyylzgWCI8ae activate inline]{Forbiddance}

  • @Embed[.Activity.6eC1vSiVDvxMmxNL activate inline]{Harmed by Running Water}

  • @Embed[.Activity.0XtDu2kazEXaLeSX activate inline]{Stake to the Heart}

  • @Embed[.Activity.OEMqQu5lIPfW7tVV activate inline]{Sunlight Hypersensitivity}

The vampire can use Charm. It then makes three Bite or Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a Draining Bite attack. If two Claw attacks hit one Large or smaller creature, the target is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 17).

items.name: Bite (Bat, Rat, or Wolf Form Only)

description.value: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

items.name: Draining Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)

description.value: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. The target’s HP maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains HP equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way and then fed at least one drop of the vampire’s blood rises the following night as a @UUID[Compendium.kp-tov-monster-vault.kp-tov-mv-bestiary.Actor.v5UX9VNwR5y1mJmo]{vampire spawn} under the vampire’s control.

One Humanoid the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be magically &Reference[charmed]{charmed} for 1 day, until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes a bonus action to end the effect. The charmed target obeys the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s verbal commands and is a willing target for the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Draining Bite attack. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have up to two creatures charmed in this way at a time. If it charms a third, the effect on the first target ends.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically calls [[/r 2d4]] @UUID[Compendium.kp-tov-monster-vault.kp-tov-mv-bestiary.Actor.J6WSA8wUKHVif124]{swarms of bats} or @UUID[Compendium.kp-tov-monster-vault.kp-tov-mv-bestiary.Actor.fIIoyvy7gfJ5RkGo]{rats}, provided that the sun isn’t up. While outdoors, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can call [[/r 3d6]] @UUID[Compendium.kp-tov-monster-vault.kp-tov-mv-bestiary.Actor.Nx3vzPiXSysYOZSz]{wolves} instead. The called creatures arrive in [[/r 1d4]] rounds, acting as allies of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and obeying its spoken commands. The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dismisses them as a bonus action. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have any number of such Beasts under its control at one time, provided the combined total CR of the Beasts is no higher than 4.

The vampire transforms into a Tiny bat, Tiny rat, Medium wolf, or back into its true form, which is Undead. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing transforms with it, but anything it is carrying doesn’t transform with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] transforms into a Medium cloud of mist or back into its true form, which is Undead. While in mist form, it can’t take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can’t pass through water. It has advantage on STR, DEX, and CON saves, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Children of the Night.

Each creature within 15 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that doesn’t have all its HP must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or lose [[/healing 4d6 average]] as its wounds bleed profusely. Before the end of its next turn, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on the next attack roll it makes against a creature that failed this save.
